page.title: 20Issues in The Shelsleys
page.content:
There are worries to disturb our tranquil country life; residents of Martley Hillside are concerned about Penny Hill quarry, now used as a tip, although thankfully, toxic waste has been banned. Nonetheless, the nuisance of heavy lorries and plagues of flies is considerable.
The Shelsleys' worries are less immediate but no less valid. With no real village centre it sometimes seems there is a lack of community spirit and little entertainment for the young.
{AUTHORS This survey was undertaken by members of the Shelsleys W.I. with the assistance of Col.T.J.Bowen, Georgina and Alexander Perry and Hilda and Vernon Webb.
